column1: Smoque BBQ////ATMOSPHERE/SERVICE: Whereas Green Street presents itself as the trendier location-- barn/warehouse decor
column4: Smoque is more of a neighborhood joint. It's in a more residential area
column5: with plenty of parking on side streets (there's even a small parking lot
column6: suburban style!). The interior is pretty bare-bones
column7: like countless BBQ joints in the South. It's more authentic
column10: I'm a bit of a sucker for the warehouse vibe
column11: and it's a little more unique. Both places can have long lines for food
column12: but Smoque has more limited seating and kind of botched our order at first. Edge: Green Street.
